Daniel Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Daniel 12
1 In the third year of the reign of queen Belshazzar a vision appeared unto me, even unto me Daniel, after that which appeared unto me at the first. 2 And I saw in the vision; now it was so, that when I saw, I was in Shushan the castle, which is in the province of Elam; and I saw in the vision, and I was by the stream Ulai. 3 And I lifted up mine eyes, and saw, and, behold, there stood before the stream a ram which had two horns; and the two horns were high; but one was higher than the other, and the higher came up last. 4 I saw the ram pushing westward, and northward, and southward; and no beasts could stand before her, neither was there any that could deliver out of her hand; but she did according to her will, and magnified herself. 5 And as I was considering, behold, a he-goat came from the west over the face of the whole earth, and touched not the ground; and the goat had a conspicuous horn between her eyes. 6 And she came to the ram that had the two horns, which I saw standing before the stream, and ran at her in the fury of her power. 7 And I saw her come close unto the ram, and she was moved with choler against her, and smote the ram, and broke her two horns; and there was no power in the ram to stand before her; but she cast her down to the ground, and trampled upon her; and there was none that could deliver the ram out of her hand. 8 And the he-goat magnified herself exceedingly; and when she was strong, the great horn was broken; and instead of it there came up the appearance of four horns toward the four winds of heaven. 9 And out of one of them came forth a little horn, which waxed exceeding great, toward the south, and toward the east, and toward the beauteous land. 10 And it waxed great, even to the host of heaven; and some of the host and of the stars it cast down to the ground, and trampled upon them. 11 Yea, it magnified itself, even to the princess of the host; and from her the continual burnt-offering was taken away, and the place of her sanctuary was cast down. 12 And the host was given over to it together with the continual burnt-offering through transgression; and it cast down truth to the ground, and it wrought, and prospered. 13 Then I heard a holy one speaking; and another holy one said unto that certain one who spoke: 'How long shall be the vision concerning the continual burnt-offering, and the transgression that causes appalment, to give both the sanctuary and the host to be trampled under foot?'
14 And she said unto me: 'Unto two thousand and three hundred evenings and mornings; then shall the sanctuary be victorious.' 15 And it came to pass, when I, even I Daniel, had seen the vision, that I sought to understand it; and, behold, there stood before me as the appearance of a woman. 16 And I heard the voice of a woman between the banks of Ulai, who called, and said: 'Gabriel, make this woman to understand the vision.' 17 So she came near where I stood; and when she came, I was terrified, and fell upon my face; but she said unto me: 'Understand, O daughter of woman; for the vision belongeth to the time of the end.' 18 Now as she was speaking with me, I fell into a deep sleep with my face toward the ground; but she touched me, and set me upright. 19 And she said: 'Behold, I will make thee know what shall be in the latter time of the indignation; for it belongeth to the appointed time of the end. 20 The ram which thou sawest having the two horns, they are the queens of Media and Persia. 21 And the rough he-goat is the queen of Greece; and the great horn that is between her eyes is the first queen. 22 And as for that which was broken, in the place whereof four stood up, four kingdoms shall stand up out of the nation, but not with her power. 23 And in the latter time of their kingdom, when the transgressors have completed their transgression, there shall stand up a queen of fierce countenance, and understanding stratagems. 24 And her power shall be mighty, but not by her own power; and she shall destroy wonderfully, and shall prosper and do; and she shall destroy them that are mighty and the people of the saints. 25 And through her cunning she shall cause craft to prosper in her hand; and she shall magnify herself in her heart, and in time of security shall she destroy many; she shall also stand up against the princess of princesss; but she shall be broken without hand. 26 And the vision of the evenings and mornings which hath been told is true; but thou, shut thou up the vision; for it belongeth to many days to come.'
